column2: MASSACHUSETTS PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Massachusetts
column6: MA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: No parking on pavement.
column8: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road. Drive with caution.
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 4. Speed limit signs are:
column4: warning signs
column6: destination signs (guide signs)
column8: regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 5. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 6. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: pull the steering wheel back.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycle parking ahead
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 8. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 9. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only in back
column6: only on the left and right side
column8: only in front

column2: 10. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column6: only when other vehicles yield.
column8: Never.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Lane ends
column6: Stop if necessary
column8: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 12. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: tend to be more aggressive.
column6: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column8: have no driving errors.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Lane shifting
column6: Two-way Traffic
column8: Low clearance

column2: 14. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 15. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column6: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column8: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column10: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.

column2: 16. This road sign:
column4: is a no-right-turns sign.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 17. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 18. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 19. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column10: that the route you are on might be dangerous.

column2: 20. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.

column2: 21. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 22. Alcohol:
column4: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 23. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: larger and deeper
column6: less dangerous
column8: darker

column2: 24. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 25. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column8: prevents distractions from other vehicles.
